title: Bethenny Frankel means business in chic white mini dress as she talks leaving RHONYC
text:
She left the Real Housewives Of New York City this summer after more than 10 years as a lightning rod cast member.

Now Bethenny Frankel is talking about what factored into her decision to leave.

Speaking at the Yahoo Finance Summit on Thursday, the businesswoman, 48, revealed she wanted to end her time on the show on a high note.

'I went with my gut': Bethenny Frankel opened up at the Yahoo Finance All Markets Summit in New York on Thursday about what factored into her decision to leave the hit series

'I just didn't want to be at the party where my eyelashes were falling off at two o'clock in the morning,' she said.

'Not literally on the show, which is what that would happen also, but I mean the metaphorical eyelash hanging off party. You know, for me, I like to leave when something is at it's peak.

'And I was talking to Bravo about many different things, and I just decided, let's roll. It's time to go.'

Bethenny went against the advice of friends who were urging her to remain on the show.

'I like to leave when something is at it's peak': Bethenny didn't want to overstay her time on the series

New chapter: Speaking of a potential return to the show, she said, 'That audience I already know. I want to connect with a new audience'

Instead, she followed her intuition.

'I went with my gut to leave,' she said.

Now Bethenny is ready for a new chapter in her life.

Speaking of a potential return to the show, she said, 'That audience I already know. I want to connect with a new audience.'

She means business: Aside from her career on reality television, Frankel is an accomplished businesswoman with her Skinnygirl brand under her belt

Bethenny revealed in August that she had decided to part ways with the series.

The reality star has been appearing on the series since 2008, and though she did leave in 2010, she did return in 2015.

'I have decided to leave the Housewives franchise to explore my next chapter,' Bethenny said in a statement, according to Variety.

'It's time to move on and focus on my daughter, my philanthropy and my production partnership with Mark Burnett, producing and starring in shows which represent a shift in the conversation for women.'

Stunning: The reality star exuded style in a white mini dress with straight hair style

Bethenny looked simply stylish as she chatted with Yahoo about her career.

The Bravo star wore a chic white mini dress, studded high heels, and a sleek hairstyle that flawlessly framed her face.

Aside from her career on reality television, Bethenny is an accomplished businesswoman with her Skinnygirl brand under her belt.

In 2011 she sold Skinnygirl Cocktails reportedly for $100 million, but retained the licensing rights to the name.
description: Speaking at the Yahoo Finance Summit on Thursday, the businesswoman revealed she wanted to leave the series on a high note. Now Bethenny is ready for a new chapter in her life.
